Key Arguments: Free speech, free opinion, and free debate are essential in a democratic society.
History shows that leaders, scientists, and media have not always been accurate, leading to negative consequences.
The proposed powers could lead to a dangerous path of destruction and corruption by stifling different viewpoints.
Censorship during the Covid-19 pandemic prevented the expression of alternative views that could have mitigated harm.
Misinformation and disinformation are often defined by those in power, which can lead to biased enforcement.
Main Themes: Covid-19 pandemic as an example of misinformation handling
Notable Quotes: Living in a democratic nation all my life, I hold free speech, free opinion and free debate at the very forefront of integrity and importance.
Different viewpoints and debate causes a healthier society. Voices removed from society cause fear, belittlement, ignorance and lack of respect and intellectual growth.
The Covid 19 pandemic response has shown that information presented by world leaders and Scientists has now been proven to be false, or itself misinformed.
